ThingDef.label: Megascarab
ThingDef.description: A large, genetically-engineered beetle. What was once the worker caste of an artifical ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight Mechanoid invasions, it is now usually seen without its deadlier insectoid cousins. Still, its size and hard shell make it dangerous when it attacks. An eusocial creature, it cannot reproduce individually.

ThingDef.label: Spelopede
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized bioengineered bug the size of a sheep. The spelopede is the middle caste of a hive, taking care of most work tasks as well as fighting with its claws.

ThingDef.label: megaspider
ThingDef.description: Not actually a spider, the megaspider is a genetically-engineered giant insectoid the size of a bear. Designed for heavy work and combat, its thick chitinous armor makes it hard to kill, while its long deadly ripper-blades make it deadly.

ThingDef.label: Cobra
ThingDef.description: A Cobra is a large snake with a venomous bite. Cobras can be highly aggressive if provoked or approached. It is better to stay away from these creatures if possible.

ThingDef.label: Monkey
ThingDef.description: A Monkey is a type of small primeape. It can use its curly tail to grab onto tree branches, which leaves its hands free to do other things.

ThingDef.label: Boomalope
ThingDef.description: Engineered for chemical production, the Boomalope grows a large sac of volatile chemicals on its back. Though it is weak and fragile for its size, other animals have learned to avoid it because of the huge explosion it produces when it dies.

ThingDef.label: Squirrel
ThingDef.description: A Squirrel is one of the many hardy, versatile rodent species that follows humankind everywhere it spreads.

ThingDef.label: Alphabeaver
ThingDef.description: A large beaver derivative genetically engineered to harvest wood with machine-like efficiency. In the absence of specialized feed, these animals will enter a manic state that compels them to eat trees whole.

ThingDef.label: Capybara
ThingDef.description: A Cabybara is the largest known natural rodent. Capybaras are well-adapted for hot environments, such as steaming jungles.

ThingDef.label: Chinchilla
ThingDef.description: A Chinchilla is a small but quick rodent that is famous for its exceptionally soft fur.

ThingDef.label: Boomrat
ThingDef.description: Either by deliberate genetic weaponization, or as an unusual defense mechanism these rodent-like creatures create a powerful fire-starting explosion when killed.

ThingDef.label: Raccoon
ThingDef.description: A small, hardy animal that ranges wide across forests and shrubland. Eats almost anything.

ThingDef.label: Rat
ThingDef.description: A rodent famous for soiling kitchens and spreading disease. Eats almost anything; lives almost anywhere.

ThingDef.label: Deer
ThingDef.description: A Deer is a medium-sized herding herbivore. It is generally peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: Ibex
ThingDef.description: The hardy wild ancestor of the domesticated goat. Ibexes live on marginal territory that most antelopes couldn't survive, eating lichens and sparse mountain plants. They're famous for dextrously hopping across bare cliff faces - and for their violent ramming attack.

ThingDef.label: Elk
ThingDef.description: An Elk is a larger member of the deer family. It is well-adapted to life in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Caribou
ThingDef.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Wild Boar
ThingDef.description: Although considered impure by some cultures, this hairy ancestor of the domesticated pig is prized for the gamey flavor of its meat.

ThingDef.label: Tortoise
ThingDef.description: This heavily armored land-dwelling reptile is known for its slow moving speed and surprisingly vicious bite.

ThingDef.label: Cougar
ThingDef.description: One of the most dangerous big cats, cougars are solitary hunters with long, sharp teeth and claws. They stalk prey from hidden positions before pouncing.\n\nWhile humans are not their normal diet, they won't turn down a meal of vulnerable human meat.

ThingDef.label: Panther
ThingDef.description: An agile and powerful big cat native to the jungles of old Earth. As solitary ambush predators, panthers are masters of taking down both large and small prey. Onlookers tend to focus on their graceful movements, while those in closer contact usually notice their skull-crushing strength.

ThingDef.label: Lynx
ThingDef.description: A wildcat larger than a housecat, but smaller than a cougar. Lynxes survive on a diet of small birds and animals. Their very warm fur keeps them safe from the brutally cold temperatures of their northern territories.

ThingDef.label: Muffalo
ThingDef.description: A Muffalo is a large herding herbivore that descended from Buffalo and has adapted to some exotic environments. It is peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: Gazelle
ThingDef.description: A small, extremely quick antelope known for its amazingly long leap.

ThingDef.label: Iguana
ThingDef.description: An Iguana is a large lizard that normally feeds on plant matter. However when angered, their tough hide and sharp claws can make them quite dangerous.

ThingDef.label: Rhinoceros
ThingDef.description: A Rhinoceros is a large land mammal with a horn on its nose. While it is typically quite peaceful, it will not hesitate to charge with its horn to fend off trespassers.

ThingDef.label: Dromedary
ThingDef.description: A Dromedary or camel is a distant cousin to horses that has adapted to survive in harsh desert climates. It has a distinctive hump in the middle of its back. It can go several days without food and water by regulating its internal temperature to avoid persperating in hot temperatures.

ThingDef.label: Elephant
ThingDef.description: An Elephant is the largest unmodified land mammal. It has a pair of long, ivory tusks that can improvise as tools for moving objects or as deadly weapons. It has a long arm-like trunk on its head that can grip and manipulate objects, much like a hand with fingers would.

ThingDef.label: Megatherium
ThingDef.description: A type of ground sloth, megatheria are giant, solitary herbivores. Long extinct after being wiped out by the natives of Earth's America continent, the ground sloth was later brought back using advanced cloning and artificial gestators.

ThingDef.label: Thrumbo
ThingDef.description: A Thrumbo is a gigantic creature of unknown origin. The Thrumbo is gentle by nature, but extremely dangerous when enraged. Its long fur is exceptionally beautiful and treasured, and its razor-sharp horn is very valuable in most markets. Legends say that an old Thrumbo is the wisest creature in the universe - it simply chooses not to speak.

ThingDef.label: Hare
ThingDef.description: This small, solitary herbivore can swiftly hop away from danger.

ThingDef.label: Snowhare
ThingDef.description: This hardy, animal survives the brutal winters of the north by burrowing through snow and finding prey underneath, or hibernating the worst months away.

ThingDef.label: Chicken
ThingDef.description: Being the most traditional domesticated farm bird, the Chicken is raised for its eggs and meat.

ThingDef.label: Pig
ThingDef.description: The Pig was one of the first animals domesticated by humans. It is commonly raised for meat and leather. While capable of being an omnivore, domesticated Pigs are raised as herbivores.

ThingDef.label: Cow
ThingDef.description: A Cow is a large, common domestic animal. It can produce large amounts of milk, or can be slaughtered for delicious meat called beef.

ThingDef.label: Alpaca
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized ungulate closely related to the llama, the Alpaca is often farmed for its remarkably soft wool.

ThingDef.label: Yorkshire Terrier
ThingDef.description: A small, even-tempered dog. Originally bred to hunt rats, it later became a show and companionship animal. This breed of dog is often nicknamed "Yorkie" to shorten the name.

ThingDef.label: Husky
ThingDef.description: A large, energetic dog with a thick fur coat for remaining comfortable in arctic environments.

ThingDef.label: Labrador Retriever
ThingDef.description: A very versatile, medium-sized dog. Originally bred to retrieve birds shot on the hunt, the lab is also an excellent guard dog, play pal, and family friend.

ThingDef.label: Warg
ThingDef.description: Wargs are heavily-muscled wolf-like creatures. Scientists say Wargs are the descendants of weaponized military animals created for population suppression. The superstitious see them as the tools of an angry god.

ThingDef.label: timber wolf
ThingDef.description: A rugged predator long feared by many ancient Earth cultures. As pack hunters, wolves have a complex social life and are fiercely intelligent.

ThingDef.label: Arctic wolf
ThingDef.description: An arctic variant of the old Earth wolf. As pack hunters, wolves have a complex social life and are fiercely intelligent.

ThingDef.label: Fennec fox
ThingDef.description: A small fox originally from the northern part of Earth's Africa continent. It hunts small creatures and has very large ears.

ThingDef.label: Red Fox
ThingDef.description: A small solitary canine evolved for hunting small prey in temperate climates.

ThingDef.label: Arctic fox
ThingDef.description: A small predator adapted for the far north. It usually hunts small game like mice and voles, sometimes burrowing through a meter of snow to reach its prey.
